Instruction: In a small bowl, whisk together sesame oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, grated ginger, and minced garlic to make the sauce.
Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the broccoli florets to the skillet and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Pour the sauce over the broccoli in the skillet and toss to coat evenly.
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the broccoli is tender but still crisp.
Remove from heat and sprinkle with sesame seeds before serving.
Enjoy hot as a flavorful and nutritious side dish.
